intro: Rabdosia scoparia, commonly known as the mountain verbena, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, arranged in dense spikes, and bloom during the summer months. Rabdosia scoparia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
